channel.title: Looky here i kinda need help with [508]
channel.description:
hello moparscape i am trying to make a 508 server for all to play
could i use client508...ip changer ?
for a number ip address or do i need hamatchi?

item.title: Looky here i kinda need help with [508]
item.dc:creator: @jobocoy2 jobocoy2
item.description:
@jobocoy2 wrote:

yes, this is because the answer he gave refers to the steps you would take reguarding a 317 client. All you ned to do is register an ip at www.no-ip.com, and then an ip changer will work fine when using that ip. alternativly you can set up a static ip and then just use that i think.

~setting up a static ip~

  1. go to control panel
  2. click network connections
  3. right click on the nertwork you are currently using and click “properties”
  4. in the small list in the middle, click "internet protocal TCP/IP
  5. type in the details, [you can find these details by clicking start --> run, type “CMD” then press enter, when the command prompt appears, type “ipconfig/all” then the details you need will come up, hope this helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Looky here i kinda need help with [508]
item.dc:creator: @Full_metal_jacket Full metal jacket
item.description:
@Full_metal_jacket wrote:

The IP changer just rewrites the IP so that you can use any client that is without .java files (the ones that you can read & write).
The IP changer is ok if you cant access the Class.java file, but if you can heres how to change the ip:

1)open up the client.java file in youe client’s folder.
2)search for either “localhost” or “127.0.0.1”
3)edit it with whatever the IP it is that you want
4)close and compile
And your done!

Read full topic
